journal-title-group.journal-title: Quarterly Journal of Finance and Accounting

title-group.article-title: Econometric Fragility of Market Anomalies: Evidence from Weekday Effect in Currency Markets

abstract.p: We show that the day-of-the-week effect in changes in spot foreign currency rates is not robust to error distributional assumptions in both returns and conditional variance. Further, the statistical significance varies inversely with the extent of leptokurtosis in the error distribution. Most strikingly, the day-of-the-week effect in conditional variance disappears completely for some currencies when we account for autocorrelation, heteroskedasticity and non-normality. Our results hold over time as well as when we consider outliers, shifts in monetary regime and presence of structural breaks. Our findings suggest that empirical regularity in financial time series may be an artifact of model inadequacy and statistical inferences and therein may be econometrically fragile.
